meanings.definition: To make something holy or sacred.
meanings.sent1: The priest will sacre the church before the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: It is important to sacre the ancient artifacts to preserve their significance.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to sacre their secret hideout by adding a 'No Adults Allowed' sign.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to sacre the canvas, turning it into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The old tree in the garden was sacred by the villagers, who believed it brought good luck.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of surprise or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Sacre! I forgot my lunch at home.
meanings.sent2: When the ball hit the window, he exclaimed, 'Sacre!'
meanings.sent3: Sacre! I can't believe I missed the bus again.
meanings.sent4: As the cake fell on the floor, she cried out, 'Sacre!'
meanings.sent5: Sacre! The sudden rain ruined our picnic plans.
